title: Ticket #184: Simplify HTML diff output
description:
#76 generates some deeply bloated output. Take, for example [13715]. It generates 1,344,629 bytes of output. This can be trimmed. In comparison, a dump of the text ("links -dump") is a mere 321,468.

  1. There are lots of places of "<span class="diffchanged2">t</span><span class="diffchanged2">b</span>". The should be merged. This change alone will drop the size to 1,154,943, maybe more since my quick test missed many cases. Probable change: edit linediff after the "for coord in l" loop, but before the "r1,r2 =" (around line 141). Do a search for the string DIFFOFF+DIFFON and replace with nothing. In addition to making the output shorter, we can better style the documents for people who want really aggressive marks for diffs.

  2. If you have two or more tabs in a row, you'll get something like, "<span class="diffponct">»</span>   ​<span class="diffponct">»</span>   ​" If you have two or more spaces in a row, you'll get "<span class="diffponct">·</span>​<span class="diffponct">·</span>​" Step 1: Have the diffponct span wrap the entire thing, including the  s and &8203;. Step 2: If you find a two adjacent diffponct blocks, merge them.
